title: "Research Design"
---

## Research Design Approaches

Research design means the strategy planned to answer research questions. There are two broad types:

1. **Quantitative Research**:
   - Objective: Quantify data, generalize results
   - Data: Numerical, structured
   - Analysis: Statistical methods
   - Example: Measuring effect of teaching methods on performance

2. **Qualitative Research**:
   - Objective: Understand concepts, experiences
   - Data: Non-numerical, unstructured
   - Analysis: Thematic, content analysis
   - Example: Exploring farmer experiences with disasters

### Mixed Methods Research

Combines both quantitative and qualitative approaches where one complements another (triangulation).

## Philosophical Approaches

1. **Inductive Approach**: Formulates theory from observations
2. **Deductive Approach**: Tests hypothesis based on theoretical framework

## Comparison of Research Designs

+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Aspect                  | Quantitative                                           | Qualitative                                                          |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Objective               | Quantify data, generalize results                      | Understand concepts, thoughts, or experiences                        |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Data Collection         | Surveys, experiments                                   | Interviews, focus groups                                            |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Data Type               | Numerical                                              | Text, audio, video                                                  |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Analysis                | Statistical (regression, ANOVA)                        | Thematic, narrative analysis                                        |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Generalizability        | High                                                   | Low                                                                  |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
